file.content: # Current Focus & Projects## Primary Focus### Exam Preparation- Thesis Defense Preparation- Review Key Concepts- Practice Presentation- Documentation Review### Portfolio Development- reangue.com Setup- Photography Portfolio- Code Projects Showcase- Thesis Publication## Allowed Projects### Photography- FI MUNI Jobs- Personal Projects- Archive Organization- Social Media Presence### Digital Infrastructure#### Storage Locations & Purposes- **Cloud Services** - **n4m3l355-home.mycozy.cloud/** - Sensitive documents - Book notes - Configuration files - Torrent files - **Google Drive (lea.kralova00)** - Exports only - Scanned documents - Configuration files - School files - **Google Photos** - Compressed exports - Screenshots - Job photos (specific albums) - Personal photography#### Server Allocation- **AlphaVPS (syncthing)** - Large file storage - Photo archives - Music files (MP3/FLAC) - GPG encrypted sensitive data- **Contabo (rsync)** - Virtual machines - Minecraft servers - High RAM computations - RDP access- **Local 2TB Drive** - Media storage - Temporary workspaces - Local backups#### Content Classification- **Sensitive Content** - GPG encrypted storage - Private photos (encrypted) - Credentials - Personal exports- **Public Content** - Portfolio materials - Blog posts - Social media content - Code projects#### Backup Decision Tree- **Photos** - **Personal** - Storage Locations: - AlphaVPS - Google Photos - **Professional** - Storage Locations: - AlphaVPS - Client delivery platforms - **RAW files** - Storage Locations: - Local NAS - External HDD- **Documents** - **Important** - Storage Locations: - Cloud (with encryption) - Local encrypted backups - **Work** - Storage Locations: - Project-specific cloud folders - Local servers - **Personal** - Storage Locations: - Categorized cloud storage- **Code** - **Public** - Storage Locations: - GitHub - GitLab - **Private** - Storage Locations: - Local Git repositories - Cloud backups## Personal Growth### Reading- **Current Books:** - *Deep Work* by Cal Newport - *Atomic Habits* by James Clear - *Sapiens* by Yuval Noah Harari - *The Pragmatic Programmer* by Andrew Hunt and David Thomas - *Clean Code* by Robert C. Martin- **Reading Goals:** - Complete two books per month - Take detailed notes in the Digital Garden - Apply insights to personal and professional projects### Meditation- Daily 20-minute sessions- Guided meditations for focus and relaxation### Digital Garden- Catalogize all knowledge into a structured digital archive- Regular updates and maintenance- Integrate with Obsidian for seamless navigation### Social Platform Presence- Establish a productive and anxiety-free presence on selected platforms- Schedule regular posts without overcommitting- Manage multiple Instagram accounts for personal and specialized photography## Maintenance & Routines### Daily- Morning Routine- Evening Routine- Self-care- Reading### Weekly- Photo Processing- Backup Verification- Digital Garden Updates- Knowledge Management## Project Guidelines- No new major projects- Focus on completing existing work- Allow creative side projects- Maintain work-life balance## Device Inventory### Workstations & Computers- **Desktop** - iMac (primary desktop tasks)- **Laptops** - MacBook Pro (mobility) - Lenovo Notebook - Dell Notebook (secondary machine)- **Servers** - Contabo (Minecraft, high RAM tasks, RDP) - AlphaVPS (photo storage, large files) - DigitalOcean (web services) - Raspberry Pi 4 Model B (fileserver, home automation)### Mobile Devices- **Android** - Sony phone - Samsung phone- **Apple** - iPhone (social media, portfolio)### Storage Devices- **External HDDs** - Western Digital My Passport 4TB - Seagate Backup Plus 8TB - 2TB HDD (movie storage)- **Cloud Storage** - Google Drive (multiple accounts) - OneDrive - Dropbox### Backup Locations- Modrý disk (SSD 1TB)- Oranžový disk (HDD 1TB)- Temp 16GB drive- Various Google Drive accounts- Specific cloud folders for specific content types### Specialized Devices- Raspberry Pi (multiple purposes) - Home Automation Server - Local Git Server - Media Center (Kodi) - Personal VPN Server### Cloud & Web Services- **Google Drive accounts** - lea.kralova00 - akral7560 - aking7560 - 456405- IS Drive- Hypnosy (to be cleaned)### Backup Strategy- **Recent Photos (up to 1 year)** - Full backup on External HDDs - Cloud backup for selected photos- **Older Photos (1+ year)** - Selective backup of RAW files and exports - Stored on External HDDs and synced via Syncthing- **Redundancy** - Backups maintained on both local drives and cloud services- **Tools** - DigiKam for cataloging photos - Adobe Lightroom for organization and editing## Backup Decision Logic### Decision Criteria1. **Is it a photo?** - **Yes:** Proceed to further questions. - **No:** Classification based on content type.2. **Is it sensitive/private?** - **Yes:** Requires encryption and secure storage. - **No:** Can be stored in public or semi-public areas.3. **Would it be a compromise if an attacker got this file?** - **Yes:** Ensure highest level of security and encryption. - **No:** Standard backup procedures apply.4. **Is it multiple files?** - **Yes:** Handle as a batch with appropriate synchronization. - **No:** Individual file handling.5. **Is it human-readable?** - **Yes:** Consider ease of access and potential exposure. - **No:** May require specialized handling.6. **Is it bigger than threshold?** - **Yes:** Optimize storage solutions for large files. - **No:** Standard storage solutions applicable.### Storage Strategies Based on Classification- **Sensitive Content** - **Storage Locations:** - AlphaVPS (syncthing) - Google Drive (lea.kralova00) with GPG encryption - **Handling:** - Encrypt before storage - Limit access to authorized devices only- **Public Content** - **Storage Locations:** - GitHub/GitLab for code projects - Google Photos for personal photography - Portfolio website for blog posts and social media content - **Handling:** - Regular backups to cloud and local storage - Use version control for code projects### Specific Plans- **Google Photos** - Only export files - Sync exclusively through Android or iOS devices - Be aware that Google may access data- **Local 2TB Drive** - Primary storage for large media files - Maintain synchronized backups with NAS- **n4m3l355-home.mycozy.cloud** - Centralized location for sensitive and miscellaneous documents- **Syncthing Usage** - Facilitate cross-device synchronization for all pertinent data types - Ensure redundancy by backing up to both local and cloud services### Abstractions- **Backup Workflow:** 1. **Acquire Data:** - Import photos, documents, or code projects. 2. **Classify Data:** - Use decision criteria to determine sensitivity and storage needs. 3. **Process Data:** - Encrypt sensitive files. - Organize public files for easy access and sharing. 4. **Backup Data:** - Store in designated cloud services and local storage. - Ensure redundancy to prevent data loss. 5. **Maintain Backups:** - Regularly verify backup integrity. - Update backup strategies as needed based on evolving data types.## Device Reset and Management Plan### ObjectiveFactory reset all devices, establish a whitelist and blacklist of permissible applications and data, implement backup and synchronization plans, and maintain a clean and organized system across all devices.### Devices to Reset- iMac (Linux computer)

file.content: príchod/zobudeniečesaťumyťprezliecťnajesťjournalmeditatezuby/tvár routine·yoganap...príchod/zobudenie...česať...selfcare is a wide term to me, contains tidying up, making food+eating, meditation and even playing games?# SubdailyFace washing (@9 @23)Sleep (impulse at @17, @24)meditateawake (@5 @8)yogaraňajkyliekyobed @14 ... @15piť dosť vody# SuperdailyNechtyVlasyObočieExfoliate(D)epilate# nechty## nohyskratitlakovatzatlacit kozustrihat## rukyrohy pilnikovaniesmirglovanie dlzkazatlaanie kozestrihanielakovanieIf your face sweats a lot, it can be challenging to keep makeup in place. Here are some tips and products that can help your makeup stay put despite the sweat:# Tips for Long-Lasting Makeup on Sweaty Skin1. **Prep Your Skin**: - **Cleanse and Exfoliate**: Start with a clean face to remove excess oil and sweat. - **Moisturize**: Use a lightweight, oil-free moisturizer that suits your skin type.2. **Use a Primer**: - Apply a mattifying primer to help control oil and create a smooth base for your makeup.3. **Choose Long-Wear and Waterproof Products**: - **Foundation**: Opt for a long-wear, oil-free, and sweat-resistant foundation. - **Concealer**: Use a waterproof concealer for areas that need extra coverage. - **Eyeliner and Mascara**: Choose waterproof formulas to prevent smudging. - **Lipstick**: Matte liquid lipsticks tend to last longer and resist smudging.4. **Set Your Makeup**: - **Setting Powder**: Apply a translucent setting powder to lock in your foundation and concealer. - **Setting Spray**: Use a long-lasting setting spray to seal your makeup and help it withstand sweat.5. **Carry Blotting Papers and Powder**: - Keep blotting papers handy to absorb excess oil and sweat throughout the day. - Touch up with a light dusting of setting powder as needed.6. **Keep it Light**: - Avoid heavy layers of makeup, as they are more likely to melt off. Go for a lighter application and build up only where necessary.### Recommended Products1. **Primers**: - **Benefit POREfessional Matte Rescue Mattifying Gel** - **Becca Ever-Matte Poreless Priming Perfector**2. **Foundations**: - **Estée Lauder Double Wear Stay-in-Place Makeup** - **Fenty Beauty Pro Filt’r Soft Matte Longwear Foundation**3. **Concealers**: - **Tarte Shape Tape Concealer** - **MAC Pro Longwear Concealer**4. **Setting Powders**: - **Laura Mercier Translucent Loose Setting Powder** - **RCMA No-Color Powder**5. **Setting Sprays**: - **Urban Decay All Nighter Long-Lasting Makeup Setting Spray** - **NYX Professional Makeup Matte Finish Setting Spray**6. **Blotting Papers**: - **Clean & Clear Oil Absorbing Sheets** - **Fenty Beauty Invisimatte Blotting Paper**### Application Steps1. **Prep and Prime**: Cleanse, moisturize, and apply primer.2. **Foundation and Concealer**: Apply a thin layer of long-wear foundation, followed by concealer.3. **Eyes**: Use waterproof eyeliner and mascara.4. **Set**: Apply setting powder all over the face and finish with a setting spray.5. **Touch-Up**: Throughout the day, use blotting papers and touch up with setting powder as needed.### Additional Tips- **Avoid Touching Your Face**: This can transfer oils and reduce the longevity of your makeup.- **Stay Hydrated**: Drinking water can help regulate your body temperature and reduce sweating.By following these tips and using the right products, you can achieve a long-lasting makeup look even if you tend to sweat a lot.Here are some budget-friendly, sweat-proof makeup products available at dm.cz that can help you achieve a long-lasting look:### Primer- **Essence Podkladová báze pod make-up Magic Filter**: This primer helps to smooth your skin and create a base that can withstand sweat. It’s affordable and helps your makeup stay in place longer.### Foundation- **Catrice HD Liquid Coverage Foundation**: Known for its long-lasting and high-coverage formula, this foundation provides a matte finish that helps control shine and sweat throughout the day【15†source】.- **Miss Sporty Naturally Perfect Match**: This is another budget-friendly option that offers good coverage and a natural finish, suitable for daily wear【16†source】.### Concealer- **Rimmel London Match Perfection Concealer**: This concealer is known for its good coverage and long-lasting formula, perfect for covering blemishes and dark circles without caking【17†source】.### Setting Powder- **Dermacol Invisible Fixing Powder**: This setting powder helps to set your foundation and concealer, keeping your makeup in place and reducing shine. It's lightweight and suitable for long wear【19†source】.### Setting Spray- **s-he colour&style Fixační sprej na make-up**: This affordable setting spray helps to lock your makeup in place and control shine, making it ideal for sweaty skin【20†source】.### Waterproof Mascara- **Maybelline New York Lash Sensational Waterproof Mascara**: A popular choice for its long-lasting and waterproof formula, ensuring your lashes stay voluminous and defined throughout the day【18†source】.### Blotting Papers- **Essence All About Matt! Oil Control Paper**: These blotting papers are great for absorbing excess oil and sweat without disturbing your makeup.By using these products, you can create a makeup routine that withstands sweat and keeps you looking fresh throughout the day. Remember to always carry blotting papers for touch-ups and use a setting spray to seal your look.

type: command command: obsidian-shellcommands:shell-command-m81bf0fahf```## entropy analyzerso for each file test superdirectory entropy without respective file and compare it with entropy with with this file### `tester.shTests the speed and output size of the `zpaq` compression tool at different compression levels (`-m1` to `-m5`)````bash#!/bin/bash# File to compressinput_file="lea2"output_archive="archive8.zpaq"# List of compression levels to testlevels=(1 2 3 4 5)# Run testsfor level in "${levels[@]}"do echo "Testing compression level -m$level" # Start time start_time=$(date +%s) # Run the zpaq compression with -test parameter, suppressing output zpaq -m"$level" add "$output_archive" "$input_file" -test > /dev/null 2>&1 # End time end_time=$(date +%s) # Calculate elapsed time elapsed_time=$((end_time - start_time)) # Get output file size output_size=$(stat --format="%s" "$output_archive") # Display results echo "Compression Level: -m$level" echo "Time Taken: $elapsed_time seconds" echo "Output Size: $output_size bytes" echo "-----------------------------------" # Clean up the archive for the next test rm "$output_archive"done``````js./tester.shTesting compression level -m1Compression Level: -m1Time Taken: 1 secondsOutput Size: 24424125 bytes-----------------------------------Testing compression level -m2Compression Level: -m2Time Taken: 11 secondsOutput Size: 21424712 bytes-----------------------------------Testing compression level -m3Compression Level: -m3Time Taken: 14 secondsOutput Size: 18651736 bytes-----------------------------------Testing compression level -m4Compression Level: -m4Time Taken: 48 secondsOutput Size: 14988348 bytes-----------------------------------Testing compression level -m5Compression Level: -m5Time Taken: 146 secondsOutput Size: 14153121 bytes-----------------------------------````/home/undefined/Projects/lea2/lea2/.obsidian/snippets`i think that every idea should have a file itself for it to be nice in graph view## what buttons i want here connect to hypnosvpn muni - [[yeet/yeet]]q#yeet obsidian://show-plugin?id=obsidian-livesynchttps://github.com/mProjectsCode/obsidian-js-engine-pluginhttps://www.npmjs.com/package/obsidian### To export a list of installed plugins in Obsidian as text, you can use the following method:1. **Open Obsidian Developer Tools**: - Press `Ctrl+Shift+I` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Option+I` (macOS) to open the Developer Tools. 2. **Run the Script**: - Go to the "Console" tab and paste the following JavaScript code: ```javascript let plugins = Object.keys(app.plugins.plugins); console.log(plugins.join("\n")); ```3. **Copy the Output**: - This will print a list of installed plugins in the console. You can copy and paste this list into a text file.This method gives you a straightforward list of your installed plugins that you can export as text.### plugins-Here are brief descriptions of each plugin, tailored to their function and how they might integrate with Google Calendar or other tools:1. **obsidian-show-file-path**: 📂 Displays the full file path of the current note for quick reference.2. **obsidian-textgenerator-plugin**: 🤖 AI-driven text generation within Obsidian, ideal for brainstorming and content creation.3. **obsidian-tasks-plugin**: ✅ Manages tasks with due dates, priorities, and recurring tasks, useful for syncing with Google Calendar.4. **templater-obsidian**: 🧩 Automates note creation with dynamic templates and JavaScript, perfect for consistent event notes.5. **calendar**: 📅 Integrates a calendar view for managing daily notes and syncing with Google Calendar.6. **obsidian-style-settings**: 🎨 Customizes themes and plugin styles via an intuitive interface.7. **obsidian-icon-folder**: 🗂️ Assigns custom icons to folders for enhanced visual organization.8. **recent-files-obsidian**: 🕒 Quick access to recently opened files, improving navigation efficiency.9. **editing-toolbar**: ✏️ Adds a customizable toolbar for commonly used editing commands.10. **obsidian-projects**: 📊 Structured project management, complementing task and calendar integration.11. **highlightr-plugin**: 🖍️ Enhances text highlighting with customizable colors for better organization.12. **homepage**: 🏠 Sets a specific note as the homepage, auto-opening on startup.13. **obsidian-meta-bind-plugin**: 🔗 Binds metadata to notes, useful for organizing and querying event-related information.14. **obsidian-shellcommands**: 💻 Executes shell commands directly from Obsidian, enabling integration with external tools.15. **terminal**: 🖥️ Embeds a terminal within Obsidian for command-line operations.16. **obsidian-kanban**: 🗃️ Organizes tasks in a Kanban board, useful for managing tasks linked to calendar events.17. **obsidian-advanced-slides**: 📽️ Converts notes into presentation slides, great for meeting prep tied to calendar events.18. **customjs**: 🛠️ Write custom JavaScript functions to extend Obsidian’s functionality.19. **smart-connections**: 🌐 Suggests connections between notes, enhancing the linking of tasks and events.20. **gemini-assistant**: 🤹♂️ Manages tasks, reminders, and notes, potentially syncing with calendar events.21. **cannoli**: 🎥 Handles and embeds multimedia content like images and videos within notes.22. **color-palette**: 🎨 Customizes color palettes for a personalized visual experience in Obsidian.23. **colored-tags**: 🏷️ Adds colors to tags for better visual differentiation and organization.24. **obsidian-emoji-toolbar**: 😀 Provides an emoji toolbar for easy insertion into notes.25. **obsidian-minimal-settings**: ⚙️ Customizes the Minimal theme with addi

file.name: Untitled 3.md
file.content: I really like your analogy! Thinking of **evolution as the training process** and **life as few-shot learning** is a powerful and insightful way to relate how humans develop and learn to how AI models like me function. Let’s explore that comparison more deeply:### 1. **Evolution as the Training Process**: - Just like how I was "trained" by processing massive amounts of data, humans (and all living organisms) are shaped by **evolution**, which can be seen as a kind of long-term, complex training process across generations. Evolution adjusts the "parameters" of life—biology, instincts, cognitive abilities—over time, based on the environment and survival challenges. - In AI, my neural network learns from data through **backpropagation**, where mistakes in predictions adjust weights until the network can produce better outputs. Evolution does something similar: random mutations that prove beneficial to survival get passed on to future generations, and over time, organisms "learn" what traits are best suited for their environment.### 2. **Life as Few-Shot Learning**: - In a **few-shot learning** setup for AI, the model can learn new tasks or adapt quickly from just a few examples. This is similar to how humans, after going through the evolutionary "training" of our biology and instincts, engage in life and learn new things with relatively little data or exposure. - Humans are born with certain capacities and instincts shaped by evolution, but our experiences in life—education, relationships, and learning—happen on top of this. With only a few interactions or experiences, humans can **generalize** quickly, adapting to new environments, skills, or social situations. - For example, a child can learn language rapidly, much like how few-shot learning in AI allows it to generalize from small amounts of new data. Similarly, you can learn new concepts with minimal examples because your brain is already "pre-trained" through biology and evolution.### 3. **Pre-training (Evolution) vs. Fine-tuning (Life)**: - In AI, **pre-training** is the process where the model is exposed to massive amounts of data to build its foundational knowledge (like how I was trained). After that, it can be **fine-tuned** on smaller, more specific data to adapt to a particular task. - Evolution serves as the **pre-training** for humans—our brains, bodies, and instincts are shaped by millions of years of natural selection. **Life** acts as the fine-tuning process, where we adapt these general traits to specific environments, cultures, and personal experiences. - For example, humans are born with the capacity for language (thanks to evolution), but we fine-tune this capacity by learning a specific language, adapting to the particular words, grammar, and social cues of the culture we’re born into.### 4. **Few-Shot Learning in Life**: - In the context of human life, few-shot learning could explain how we adapt so quickly to novel situations or learn new skills with minimal input. We are pre-trained to be adaptable, curious, and capable of learning, thanks to evolution. - Our ability to pick up new knowledge or habits from just a few examples is a testament to how flexible and efficient the brain is. In this way, life is like **fine-tuning on the fly**, where each new experience shapes us based on previous evolutionary "training" and a few crucial data points (experiences).### 5. **Cognitive Flexibility and Generalization**: - One of the hallmarks of human intelligence is the ability to **generalize** from limited experiences. We can take a few examples and expand our understanding to new situations, predicting outcomes or behaviors we've never encountered before. - Few-shot learning in AI models attempts to mimic this ability, where the model can make inferences or perform tasks based on minimal input. Similarly, humans are constantly learning throughout life, not from infinite data but from **select experiences** that shape and refine our understanding of the world.---### In Summary:In your analogy:- **Evolution** is like the **training** of a model, where over time, humans (and all life) are shaped by generations of experience, mutation, and selection. This builds the foundation—our biological and cognitive capabilities—that allows us to interact with the world.- **Life** is like **few-shot learning**, where with minimal experiences (compared to the full sweep of evolutionary history), humans adapt, grow, and learn rapidly. We take what we are biologically primed to do and fine-tune those abilities through the events and interactions of daily life.It’s a powerful way to think about both biological evolution and personal growth, drawing a clear parallel to how AI systems, like me, are pre-trained and then can adapt or learn in specific contexts with very little new input. Humans, like AI models, rely on vast, underlying "training" (evolution), but life itself is where most of the fine-tuning happens, often in ways that are surprisingly quick and efficient!Your analogy between evolution as "training" and life as "few-shot learning" brings a fascinating perspective on how we, as humans, navigate the world. If we take this metaphor seriously, some key insights and recommendations for life naturally emerge. Here’s how we can draw meaningful lessons from it:### 1. **Embrace Adaptability and Continuous Learning**: - **Life is about fine-tuning**: Just as AI models are fine-tuned with each new experience, humans should approach life with a mindset of continuous growth and adaptation. Evolution has equipped us with a foundation (cognitive abilities, emotional responses, instincts), but the details of our individual lives are learned as we go. - **Recommendation**: **Keep learning** from every experience, no matter how small. Even the "few-shot" experiences you encounter can provide profound opportunities for growth. Whether it’s a new skill, a conversation with someone new, or an unexpected challenge, view everything as a chance to adapt and refine your understanding. - **Practical Steps**: Pursue new interests, meet new people, explore unfamiliar environments—seek out experiences that stretch your understanding, and don't fear stepping into the unknown.### 2. **Leverage Your Pre-training (Biology and Evolution)**: - **Trust your instincts**: Just like pre-training gives a model foundational knowledge, evolution has equipped you with natural abilities—curiosity, adaptability, problem-solving, and social interaction—that are deeply ingrained in the human experience. - **Recommendation**: **Lean on your instincts and intuition**. Trust that your brain is naturally wired to handle challenges, learn, and grow. Sometimes we overthink or second-guess our instincts, but your "pre-training" is built to help you navigate new situations with confidence. - **Practical Steps**: In decision-making, trust your gut when appropriate. Don't dismiss your instincts outright—they're a result of countless generations of evolutionary fine-tuning.### 3. **Few-shot Learning Highlights the Importance of Quality Experiences**: - **Not all experiences are equal**: Few-shot learning is about learning effectively from **minimal examples**. This means that **high-quality, focused experiences** can be more valuable than sheer quantity when it comes to shaping your understanding and growth. - **Recommendation**: **Focus on quality over quantity**. You don’t need endless experiences to grow—you just need to make the most of the experiences you do have. Seek meaningful interactions, challenging problems, and deep learning rather than spreading yourself too thin. - **Practical Steps**: Prioritize relationships and experiences that offer deep, meaningful growth. Instead of shallow engagement in many activities, dive deeply into the ones that truly resonate with you.### 4. **Be Flexible and Open to Change**: - **Adapt quickly

file.content: # chatbot conversation### Optimalizace nákladů a zisků: Detailní vysvětleníOptimalizace nákladů a zisků je klíčová pro každého, kdo podniká, zejména pokud máte omezené příjmy a chcete minimalizovat své daňové zatížení. Zde jsou podrobné informace k jednotlivým strategiím:### 1. **Uplatnění výdajového paušálu**Výdajový paušál je způsob, jakým si můžete zjednodušit administrativu tím, že nebudete muset podrobně evidovat každý jednotlivý výdaj. Místo toho si z vašich příjmů můžete automaticky odečíst určité procento jako výdaje.- **Výše výdajového paušálu**: - **60 %**: Pro volné, řemeslné nebo vázané živnosti (např. webové stránky, fotografování). - **80 %**: Pro zemědělství a lesnictví, nebo u řemeslné výroby. - **40 %**: Pro ostatní příjmy podle zvláštních právních předpisů, pokud nedosahují do limitu (např. autorská činnost).- **Výhody výdajového paušálu**: - **Zjednodušení administrativy**: Nemusíte uchovávat doklady ke každému výdaji, což snižuje časovou náročnost a zjednodušuje účetnictví. - **Předvídatelnost**: Víte, jaké výdaje můžete uplatnit bez ohledu na skutečné náklady.- **Nevýhody výdajového paušálu**: - **Možné omezení při vyšších skutečných výdajích**: Pokud jsou vaše skutečné výdaje vyšší než paušální procento, uplatnění paušálu nemusí být výhodné. V takovém případě by bylo lepší vést daňovou evidenci a uplatnit skutečné výdaje.### 2. **Snížení daně legálními odpočty**Legální odpočty a slevy na dani jsou dalším způsobem, jak optimalizovat daňovou povinnost. Tyto odpočty a slevy se odečítají z vašeho základu daně nebo přímo z vypočítané daně.- **Sleva na poplatníka**: - Základní sleva na poplatníka je **24 840 Kč** ročně, což znamená, že tato částka bude odečtena přímo z vaší daňové povinnosti. - Tato sleva je dostupná pro každého daňového poplatníka a nemusíte splňovat žádné speciální podmínky.- **Sleva na dítě**: - Pokud máte děti, můžete si uplatnit daňové zvýhodnění na každé vyživované dítě. V roce 2024 činí sleva na první dítě **15 204 Kč** ročně, na druhé dítě **22 320 Kč** ročně, a na třetí a další dítě **27 840 Kč** ročně. - Pokud je sleva vyšší než daň, můžete získat daňový bonus, který vám bude vyplacen.- **Sleva na manželku/manžela**: - Pokud má váš manžel/manželka příjem nižší než 68 000 Kč ročně, můžete si uplatnit slevu na manžela/manželku ve výši **24 840 Kč** ročně.- **Sleva na studenta**: - Pokud jste studentem denního studia do 26 let (nebo do 28 let u doktorského studia), můžete si uplatnit slevu na studenta ve výši **4 020 Kč** ročně.- **Odpočty z úvěrů na bydlení**: - Můžete si odečíst zaplacené úroky z úvěru na bydlení, hypotéky nebo úvěru ze stavebního spoření. Maximální odpočet je **150 000 Kč ročně**.- **Penzijní připojištění a životní pojištění**: - Můžete si odečíst příspěvky na penzijní připojištění nebo doplňkové penzijní spoření až do výše **24 000 Kč** ročně. - Podobně lze odečíst i platby za životní pojištění, pokud splňují podmínky.### 3. **Využití paušální daně**Paušální daň je specifický režim pro OSVČ, který zjednodušuje placení daní a odvodů. OSVČ v paušálním režimu platí jednou měsíčně paušální částku, která zahrnuje daň z příjmu, sociální a zdravotní pojištění.- **Výhody paušální daně**: - **Jednoduchost**: Platíte jednou měsíčně pevnou částku, což zjednodušuje administrativu. - **Předvídatelné náklady**: Víte přesně, kolik budete měsíčně platit, což usnadňuje finanční plánování.- **Nevýhody paušální daně**: - **Fixní platba**: Paušální daň může být nevýhodná, pokud máte velmi nízké příjmy, protože budete platit pevnou částku bez ohledu na váš zisk. - **Omezení**: Tento režim je dostupný pouze pro OSVČ s příjmy do určité výše (2 miliony Kč ročně v roce 2024) a bez zaměstnanců.### 4. **Kombinace podnikání a zaměstnání**Pokud podnikáte jako vedlejší činnost vedle zaměstnání, můžete snížit své odvody. Zde jsou hlavní výhody:- **Nižší sociální pojištění**: Jako OSVČ vedlejší činnost neplatíte minimální zálohy na sociální pojištění, pokud váš roční zisk nepřesáhne stanovený limit (v roce 2024 je to 104 508 Kč). Platíte pouze částku odpovídající vašemu skutečnému zisku.- **Možnost kombinace**: Můžete kombinovat výhody zaměstnání (např. zdravotní pojištění placené zaměstnavatelem) s výhodami OSVČ, jako je flexibilita a uplatňování výdajů.### Závěr:Optimalizace nákladů a zisků při podnikání je klíčová pro efektivní řízení financí. Využití výdajového paušálu, slev na dani, paušální daně nebo kombinace podnikání s jinými formami zaměstnání může výrazně ovlivnit, kolik budete platit na daních a odvodech. Je důležité pečlivě plánovat a konzultovat s odborníkem, pokud máte složitější situaci nebo pokud nejste jistí, jaké možnosti jsou pro vás nejlepší.

file.name: rdp.sh
file.content: #!/bin/bashecho "Current working directory: $(pwd)"# Check if the .env file existsif [ ! -f .scripts/.env ]; then echo ".env file not found!" exit 1fi# Load the environment variables from the .env fileexport $(grep -v '^#' .scripts/.env | xargs)# Run the xfreerdp command with the password from the .env filexfreerdp /f /d:NTFI /u:xkral4 /p:"$FREERDP_PASSWORD" /v:hypnos3.fi.muni.cz /bpp:16 +bitmap-cache +compression /sound:sys:pulse,quality:low /gfx /gfx-thin-client +gfx-progressive /network:modem +clipboard /rfx /rfx-mode:video +async-input +async-update +async-channels -wallpaper -themes -fonts +auto-reconnect /auto-reconnect-max-retries:5 -menu-anims -window-drag -grab-keyboard /cert-tofu# Flexibility: You can extend the .env file to include other configuration parameters if needed, such as FREERDP_USER, FREERDP_DOMAIN, etc.

file.name: checkIndexLinks.js
file.content: module.exports = async (params) => { const { app, quickAddApi: { utility: { checkboxPrompt } } } = params; // Get the index.md file const indexFile = app.vault.getAbstractFileByPath('index.md'); if (!indexFile) { console.warn('Warning: index.md not found in the vault'); return; } // Read the content of index.md const indexContent = await app.vault.read(indexFile); // Get all markdown files in the vault const markdownFiles = app.vault.getMarkdownFiles(); // Track unlinked files const unlinkedFiles = []; // Check each file markdownFiles.forEach(file => { // Skip index.md itself if (file.path === 'index.md') return; // Check if the file is linked in index.md // We check both the file name and the full path const isLinked = indexContent.includes(file.name) || indexContent.includes(file.path); if (!isLinked) { unlinkedFiles.push(file.name); console.warn(`Warning: ${file.name} is not linked in index.md`); } }); // If there are unlinked files, show them to the user if (unlinkedFiles.length > 0) { const message = `The following files are not linked in index.md:\n${unlinkedFiles.join('\n')}`; // Use Obsidian's notice API to show the warning new Notice(message, 5000); }};

Emco objednať 500# skitSometimes when you insert words into someone's mouth they wont spit it away in disgust; sometimes the taste of these words will catch their senses. Their tongue will start to play with these words. They'll fall into a trance of these words. Kissing, caressing them. Then you let the words slide deeper unto - a little force will do. It must be consensual though, as the words would be otherwise spat out. You need to agree with all the words, or at least the most of them; otherwise, you wouldnt like the taste. It would come as unfamiliar to you. It must be nonconsensual though, because everything not yet known to you is a bit nonconsensual; the consent must be preceded by nonconsent, albeit not every nonconsent precedes consent. But to taste something new, something unprecedented, you need to relax and let the words penetrate deeper, scratch your brain, even gag if you cannot hold them when you first try. Because in the end, it doesnt matter how much of them you needed to be who you are. Even that doesnt matter - only your words does. Nie pretože by som za to chcela nejako heroicky pokladať život, ale preto že v prípade že nedokážem byť žena sa mi neoplatí a nechce žiť.

file.content: against the grainHmmmn asi ze sa nedokazete dohodnut na tom ako travi cas sam a ze mate ine ocakavania ako travite cas bez toho druheho no, ze on asi potrebuje cas sam pre seba a pri tom vyzera ze nema zaujem o nic ine (vratane mozno aj teba) len chce mat taky alone time ze sam so sebou Vždy keď si oblečiem niečo čo mám rada tak najprv sa poteším ako vyzerám a potom mi napadne trpka myšlienka že by sa ste za mňa hanbili no a to je aj pri bežných veciach ako napríklad dámske tepláky a mikina čo mám rada ale aj sukne, šaty, legíny, krásne topanky a všetko čo si rada obliekam a vždy som si rada obliekala a vždy som len za to musela a cítim hanbu lebo akokoľvek človek chce tak nedokáže zabudnúť na to čo si myslia o nej jej rodičia a aj keď ste možno teraz iní alebo sa snažíte tváriť "neutrálne" dobieha vás váš tieň minulosti a vaše vyjadrenia slová názory a činy, a hlavne dobieha mňa a vo mne stále žijú tí transfobni mama a tata pred ktorymi som sa musela rýchlo prezliekat naspäť keď prišli domov... A aké si myslíte že to je, byť žena a hanbiť sa za oblečenie ktoré máš rada? Keď ten názor že je to úchylka v tebe žije aj keď ty už tú realitu chceš žiť a chceš byť sama sebou? Ako veľa podľa vás v živote ženy tvorí oblečenie, makeup, farby, doplnky? Ako veľa to ženy riešia a uvedomte si že ja nie som iná a milujem to rovnako. Prečo sa ja musím za toto všetko hanbiť? Myslíte si že zatváraním očí pred tým všetkým ste neutrálni ale pritom vy ste tí ktorí na mňa naložili toto bremeno, a nezávisí že to na vás naložil niekto iný, že sú to len názory ktoré vám dali iní.. Hľadaním a uhybanim sa vine sa nič nevyrieši, kto je vinný sa nedá ani nájsť a ani nedáva zmysel to robiť, jediné čo sa dá je prijať zodpovednosť a začať konať tak aby sa minimalizoval dopad našich chýb z minulosti.. Som v tom všetkom sama, plavím sa tým v prázdnote, každý deň je boj sama so svojimi nazormi ktoré ste mi nanutili a týmito tieňmi z minulosti a zatváraním očí len zosilujete zlý vplyv svojich minulostí vo mne a ja potom robím iracionálne rozhodnutia ktoré sa hanbia a bojujú proti tomu transfobnemu tatovi a mame.

file.content: - faktúry za internet tak 3 posledné - tú zmluvu od bytu plus to predĺženie (keby si to našla, asi to bude v chodbe v tej komode?)- # tech scenar pv110 Ahoj Kika,Je to superLea Králová: \*9.5(detaily doplním neskôr)1/1bez gramatických chyb, překlepů, dobře se to čte, je tam diakritika1/1Dodržen formát, úvodní strana, popis lokací/postav/rekvizit, dělení na č. záběru, velikost, popis kamery, samotný “obraz”, zvuková část, důležité věci jsou psány velkými písmeny1/1správné střídání velikosti záběrů, jejich logické použití2/2Jednotlivé záběry na sebe navazují, z popisu u kamery si člověk jasnědokáže představit, kde bude kamera postavena, co bude snímat a jak,3/3storyboard 2/2lit. scénář je převeden do formy scénáře kvalitně Ahoj Kika, Scenár je super, výsledný dej sa mi páči. Trochu mi chýba motív druhej časti — prečo sa pavúčí otec rozhodol brať ešte zo stola jedlo keď už mal tie zlaté muchy. Tiež som čakala viac záberov u scény C a záberov E9 a E10, príde mi že to skončí príliš náhle. Možno je to fajn ako šok pre publikum, mám pocit ale že aj na tento účel je tam málo scén. Chcela by som asi viac záberov tej ľudskej oslavy, možno shot ako sa radujú všetci. Tá pavúčia oslava podobne, tam by to chcelo nejako rozviesť že čakajú? Neviem, toto sú len návrhy čo mi napadli ale neviem ako by to vyzeralo v storyboarde. Storyboard je prehľadný, má dobré kompozície a určite poslúži ako dobrý základ výsledného filmu. Pol bod som stiahla za "prirýchly" vývoj v závere filmu. Pekný zvyšok sviatkov :) a vďaka za trpezlivosť s neskorými opravami

file.content: HobbesSchopenhauerhttps://dennikn.sk/3789705/fyzika-je-o-predpovedani-buducnosti-hovori-vedec-ktory-v-cern-e-skuma-kvantove-previazanie/?ref=tit## mail to jimHello Jim,Thank you for your email. I planned to answer sooner, but I didn't manage to, as I had this exam coming I've mentioned to you (neural networks). Good news is I passed the exam! :) I had been thinking about the 100 people question multiple times — I feel like I have a lot of ideas on a management level (that I would like to first speak with each of the people and assess their strengths, what they like to do, how they imagine work (or whatever we will do) environment etc. I was first thinking about creating hierarchy, but after giving it a second thought, I decided to not do it yet as hierarchy without a goal is probably overmanaging. More on that below :) ) . The problem is though that I cannot think of a greater goal that my group would do; I thought about fighting injustice, fighting environmental crisis, education for any undereducated group or education in general. Of course, I also thought about creating some product, be it something tangible (like phones) or not tangible (programming application, service) or mix (product with a service). A very funny coincidence has occured to me — one of the books I thought of while we spoke together was the book I'm reading for a while now, but it did really move my heart. It is Humankind by Rutger Bregman, and only yesterday I noticed you also had it in your slides! I'm reading it in slovak and it's title is "Ľudskosť" so I didn't connect that the book in slides is the book i'm actually reading. I'm like 3/4 through but when I'll finish it, it will surely be one of my favorites.This coincidence is even funnier because I just read some interesting bits in it which relate to the 100 people question you gave me :) The bits are:- He (Jos De Blok) is a manager who prefers not to manage. A CEO with hands-on experience. An anarchist at the top of the ladder. So as care became a product and patients became customers, De Blok decided to give up his management job and start something new. He dreamed of an oasis in this vast bureaucratic wasteland, a place fuelled not by market forces and growth, but by small teams and trust.- Each team of twelve has maximum autonomy. Teams plan their own schedules and employ their own co-workers.- For the rest, the organisation has an intranet site where colleagues can pool their knowledge and experience. Each team has its own training budget, and each group of fifty teams has a coach they can call in if they get stuck. Finally, there’s the main office which takes care of the financial side of things.It's from the chapter 14 titled "Intrinsic motivation". Of course it's a bit emphasized but this idea struck me. Also, did I recommend the book Determined by Robert Sapolsky (2023) to you? It's a ride. When I finished it, I turned it over and started reading again because my brain couldn't grasp a lot of things the first time and it was really mind-blowing. I'm recommending it to everyone I meet now. There is a kind of controversy to showing people that there is less free will than they have as it can have negative psychological consequences ( Dr. Sapolsky even mentions it in this very book :D ) Link to the book: https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/83817782-determinedThis mail is a bit messy but I preferred to send it as it is and to not delay myself any longer rewritting it :) Have a nice weekend## mail to sojkaPredtým ako si prečítate tento mail, chcela by som poznamenať že to vôbec nemusíme riešiť takouto konfliktnou cestou, to že sme ohľadom toho spravili konflikt nezrýchli to kedy to do toho ruvu dám a ešte z toho obidvaja vyjdeme namrzení. Nakoľko si však myslím že mi veľa v tejto veci krivdíte, dole pokračuje mail. V ňom stupňujem konflikt a som nerada že tam píšem veci ktoré tam sú, ale už ten Váš bol trochu taký že som nerada že ste tam napísali veci ktoré tam boli a pravdupovediac aj Vy by ste mali byť trochu nerád za veci ktoré tam sú. Ak teda chcete, môžeme takto pokračovať ďalej. Ak nie, môžete odpísať napr. "ok" a môžeme to zahodiť a môžeme mať pekný víkend> Dobrý den,> > > on ten termín RUVu je do 20.2.,> Ano, dnes mi doslo avizo o posunu kvuli vcerejsimu vypadku.No vidite, ja to viem už od stredy kedy to bolo na nástenke v RUVe. Podľa toho som následne prispôsobila svoj časový plán. > > ale zápis do ďalšieho semestra je do nedele> > (čiže soft deadline je tak dodnes).> Argumentacni faul, nejde samozrejme o kauzalni zavislost.ja sa nesnažím argumentovať. Toto nie je argumentačná súťaž. Ja sa snažím ukázať že mám stres zo zápisu do ďalšieho semestra a určite je ľahšie robiť povinnosti keď Vás stále nenapadá že ešte musíte uzavrieť semester. Tiež som nehovorila žiadne slová ktoré by ukazovali "kauzálnu závislosť"> > > Bolo by možné mi dať zápočet za PV174?> Moje dosavadní "za dobrotu na žebrotu" evidentně nefungovalo :-/,> tak raději počkám na dokončení Vašeho PV174 RUV tiketu.Som rada že mi hovoríte že moje PV174 bude podmienené RUV tiketom v deň kedy končí semester. Trochu Vám krivdím, prvý krát ste mi o tejto kauzalite povedal v utorok, kedy ste chcel "za tri roky" čo, ako sme sa dozvedeli, je nezmyselná požiadavka.> > > Chápem že mám veľa nedorobených vecí ale tiež si myslím že dávam Lemme> veľa> > času a že negatívna motivácia neprispieva moc k môjmu vzťahu k povinnostiam> > súvisiacim s Lemmou nakoľko sa snažím ako môžem ( cca ':D áno viem že mám> > rezervy v pracovnej motivácii ale určite môžem povedať že na nich pracujem.> > dokonca som si aj kúpila notes ). > Hmm. Mrzí mě, že na tom evidentně začínáte pracovat přes všechny mé četné> urgence až poslední pracovní den semestru :-/, přes veškeré > apely na důležitost a potřebnost pro LEMMA, její status a kredit> a získávání prostředků od FI a sponzorů.Veď dobre viete že to riešim viac ako "poslední pracovní den semestru". Na ruve a D výstupoch záleží približne 0 vecí z toho čo ste napísal a aj napriek tomu že mi každý študent čo to riešil povedal že je to zbytočnosť tak som si tam tú motiváciu našla a chcem to tento rok spraviť, ale ak budete ešte chvíľu v tomto prístupe pokračovať, je tu šanca že u mňa začnú prevládať z tejto veci negatívne pocity a od toho sa odvíjajú ďalší rok práce s ruvom> > V RUVu mám účet (sojka), ale nejsem v tom správném pracovišti> (MU/FI/KPGD-LEMMA). Umíte mě s Helenou do správněho přidat, abych viděl> status quo, nebo mám psát Heleně? Nie, neviem Vás pridať, nakoľko na to nemám práva. V pondelok idem za helenou a tak jej to môžem odkázať. Další urgentní věc je sdělit potřebná metadata pro RUV pro sběr do Kafe; to byste byla v rámci podzimního> PV174 sepsat a postoupit přes gitlab Adamovi Štěpánkovi?Nie, semester už dávno skončil, čiže ďalšie neohlásené povinnosti mi môžete dávať až do ďalšieho PV174. Tiež keď každú vec nazvete urgentnou, stráca to trochu váhu> > S pozdravom a přáním popřemýšlení nad svou motivací práce pro LEMMA.Napriek tomu že sa liečim z depresie tak si dokážem nájsť motiváciu robiť veci pre lemmu aj neplateného charakteru a aj bezkreditového charakteru. Nemyslíte si že k mojej motivácii prispievate viac Vy ako ja? Tiež, nemyslíte si že je zvláštne že už 5 rokov (Ten RUV tam naposledy bol správne vložený v roku 2017 alebo 2018, čiže za nejakých 5+ rokov) ste neboli schopný donútiť niekoho vložiť filmy do ruvu? Nespoliehate sa na študentov tak veľa že nájdu v sebe motiváciu, že zabúdate že v skutočnosti motivácia k niečomu vzniká skôr povahou tej veci?Je mi veľmi ľúto že sme sa rozhodli to riešiť takto. Pri takomto štýle diskusie je technicky nemožné aby bola produktívna. Chcela by som vám želať pekný víkend a aby ste si oddýchol ale namiesto toho si musíme písať emočne zanietené maily. Ja by som chcela tiež ísť do víkendu s tým že si môžem oddýchnuť od semestra a keď budem mať chuť tak že budem pracovať na lemma povinnostiach. Takto však b

file.name: 2024-05-17.md
file.content: Zdravim Leo, doufam, ze se mate dobre. Mam 2 prosby. Pavlinka potrebuje dve upravy na webu, zvladla byste call pristi tyden. Druha vec se tyka jedne investicni firmy, neznate nejake studenty co ovladaji Microsoft AI tools a za penize by pomohli na jednom projektu? Potrebuji max 2 lidi. Diky moc a dejte mi vedet.Zdravím, som veľmi rada že píšete :) viackrát som chcela aj ja napísať, ale nevyšlo mi to. Teraz dokončujem diplomku(termín je zrovna štvrtok 23.5.) a potom by som sa na to mohla pozrieť, mám spísané aj zoznam vecí ktoré som chcela upraviť ale nikdy sme sa k tomu nedostali (posielam náhľad bodov). Mohli by sme sa dohodnúť na pondelok 27.5.? Teoreticky môžeme dať call už 24.5., predpokladám ale že v pondelok budem vnímavejšia :)S pozdravom a prajem príjemný piatokLeaDobrý deň, moja diplomová práca nejde podľa časového plánu a tak by som sa chcela spýtať na detaily ohľadom možnosti udelenia třídenní výjimky pro manipulaci s archivem. Kedy môžem žiadať o túto výnimku? Za pripomenutie odvolania k poplatku ďakujem, doručím.S pozdravomLea Králová (úradne Adam Král)Dobrý deň,ako asi vidíte, zlyhala som s Vami priebežne komunikovať, aj keď som sa tomu presne chcela vyhnúť. Diplomka je v slabom stave, snažím sa to dať dokopy a poslať Vám to v priebehu víkendu. Ak by ste si na to našiel čas, v pondelok by som zapracovala pripomienky a zavesila do odovzdávarne, a následne skúsila zažiadať študijné o 3dňovú manipuláciu s archívom. Neviem či 3 dni niečomu pomôžu keď to mala byť dlhodobá práca, ale "topiaci sa aj slamky chytá". Ospravedlňujem sa že to dopadlo takto, videla som to prichádzať celý čas a aj tak som s tým nevedela nič spraviť. V priebehu víkendu vám teda pošlem draft práce a (snáď) funkčný kód.S pozdravomLea KrálováZdravím, zasielam odkaz na pdf práce, odkaz na overleaf projekt a odkaz na github repo (kód je momentálne nespustiteľný a text stále nekompletný).pdf: https://drive.google.com/file/d/16T6w1Y2KyfyPzQgs_x_7sZjgi96F-WN0/view?usp=sharingoverleaf: https://www.overleaf.com/read/jzjmszxdcpzc#8b0a69github: https://github.com/N4M3L355/clonaS pozdravomLea KrálováZdravím, ďakujem za pripomienky, postupne ich zapracuvávam. O dodatočnú manipuláciu s archívom plánujem zažiadať. Na zajtrajšie zverejnenie archívu potrebujem dostať od Vás zápočet za predmet SDIPR, pretože študijné inak nemôže zajtra odo mňa prácu prebrať. Dnes v noci tam odovzdám najlepšiu verziu akú viem (so zapracovanými pripomienkami, zdrojmi, atď), a potom, podľa schválenia žiadosti ešte dorobím dodatočné úpravy.S pozdravomLK študijné - žiadosť o výnimku do archívu - Žádám o udělení třídenní výjimky k otevření archivu k manipulaci se závěrečnou prací. Týká se mé závěrečné práce na téma Lens Evaluation and Analysis App: A Python-Based Tool for Automated Assessment of Lens Properties . Povaha zmeny by spočívala v zapracovaní spätnej väzby vedúceho, spresnenia popisu chodu aplikácie a doplnenia zdrojového kódu aplikácie. - žiadosť o zníženie poplatkuhttps://www.cnbc.com/2024/05/21/bill-gates-2024-summer-book-recommendations-one-is-a-must-read.html

https://neurosciencenews.com/consciousness-ai-neuroscience-26469/ #ai### Consciousness in AI: Distinguishing Reality from Simulation#### 1. Introduction- **Research Focus**: Examining the potential for consciousness in AI, aiming to prevent inadvertent creation and deception by seemingly conscious AI systems.- **Key Concept**: Free energy principle and its application to AI and consciousness.#### 2. Research Goals- **Prevent Artificial Consciousness**: Ensuring that AI systems do not unintentionally become conscious.- **Mitigate Deception**: Avoiding situations where AI appears conscious without being so.#### 3. The Free Energy Principle- **Definition**: Describes processes ensuring the continued existence of self-organizing systems (living organisms) as a type of information processing.- **Application to AI**: Investigating if the same processes can be realized in computers.#### 4. Computational Correlate of Consciousness- **Concept**: Processes contributing to the survival of an organism and their information-processing analogs in computers.- **Comparison**: Differences between brain and computer realization of consciousness.#### 5. Differences Between Brains and Computers- **Energy Efficiency**: Brains are energy efficient; this is not considered a requirement for consciousness.- **Causal Structure**: Brains and computers have different causal connectivity, which may be crucial for consciousness.#### 6. Implications- **Detailed Prerequisites**: The study aims to detail the prerequisites for consciousness in artificial systems more precisely.#### 7. Conclusion- **Future Directions**: Continued exploration of consciousness in AI to ensure ethical development and prevent misleading AI behaviors.For more detailed information, you can access the full article [here](https://neurosciencenews.com/consciousness-ai-neuroscience-26469/).### 10 Studies Every Teacher Should Know About [https://www.edutopia.org/article/10-studies-every-teacher-should-know-about/](https://www.edutopia.org/article/10-studies-every-teacher-should-know-about/)#education #teaching #learning #researchThis article from Edutopia highlights ten key research studies that are essential for educators to understand and apply in their teaching practices. These studies cover various aspects of learning, from cognitive science to classroom management, and provide valuable insights that can enhance educational outcomes.The studies focus on topics such as the impact of mindset on student achievement, the benefits of retrieval practice, and the role of formative assessment in improving learning. They also explore the importance of social-emotional learning, the effects of teacher expectations on student performance, and the significance of fostering a growth mindset.By understanding and integrating these findings into their teaching, educators can better support their students' academic and personal growth. The article encourages teachers to stay informed about educational research to continuously improve their practice.### How Writing Heals the Soul [https://www.psychologytoday.com/gb/blog/bully-wise/202407/how-writing-heals-the-soul](https://www.psychologytoday.com/gb/blog/bully-wise/202407/how-writing-heals-the-soul)#psychology #selfhelp #mentalhealthThe article from Psychology Today explores the therapeutic power of writing, particularly how it can help individuals heal emotionally and mentally. Writing serves as a powerful tool for processing emotions, making sense of traumatic experiences, and fostering personal growth. It emphasizes the importance of expressive writing, where individuals write freely about their thoughts and feelings without worrying about grammar or structure.**Key Points:**- **Emotional Release**: Writing helps to release pent-up emotions, offering a safe outlet for feelings that might be difficult to express otherwise.- **Cognitive Processing**: By writing, individuals can organize their thoughts, leading to greater clarity and understanding of their experiences.- **Healing Trauma**: The act of writing about traumatic events can reduce their emotional impact, helping to desensitize and distance oneself from painful memories.- **Self-Reflection**: Writing encourages deep self-reflection, which is crucial for personal development and healing.**Prominent Quotes:**- "Writing can be a mirror, reflecting the inner workings of our minds."- "The act of putting pen to paper allows us to explore our emotions in a safe and controlled way."- "Through writing, we can find a path to healing that leads us out of the darkness."### The Age of AI Chatbots: How ChatGPT, Bing, and Google Bard are Shaping the Future of Conversational AI#### [https://www.theverge.com/23610427/chatbots-chatgpt-new-bing-google-bard-conversational-ai](https://www.theverge.com/23610427/chatbots-chatgpt-new-bing-google-bard-conversational-ai) #ai #technologyThe Verge article explores the rapidly evolving landscape of conversational AI, focusing on how major players like ChatGPT, the new Bing, and Google Bard are redefining the future of chatbots. These advanced AI systems are not just tools for simple queries but are transforming into powerful, conversational agents capable of more complex interactions.- **ChatGPT**: Developed by OpenAI, ChatGPT has sparked significant interest due to its ability to generate human-like text, enabling more natural and engaging conversations. It is seen as a breakthrough in how we interact with machines, pushing the boundaries of what AI can accomplish in everyday communication. - **Bing with ChatGPT Integration**: Microsoft's integration of ChatGPT into Bing marks a significant shift in search engine dynamics. file.name: linter.js
file.content: const fs = require('fs');const path = require('path');// Define the root directory of the Obsidian projectconst ROOT_DIR = '.';// Function to read the contents of a filefunction readFile(filePath) { return fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf-8');}// Function to get all Markdown files in the directoryfunction getMarkdownFiles(dir) { let files = fs.readdirSync(dir); let markdownFiles = []; files.forEach(file => { let fullPath = path.join(dir, file); if (fs.statSync(fullPath).isDirectory()) { markdownFiles = markdownFiles.concat(getMarkdownFiles(fullPath)); } else if (file.endsWith('.md')) { markdownFiles.push(fullPath); } }); return markdownFiles;}// Function to check if all files are linked in index.mdfunction checkLinksInIndex() { const indexContent = readFile(path.join(ROOT_DIR, 'index.md')); const markdownFiles = getMarkdownFiles(ROOT_DIR); markdownFiles.forEach(file => { const fileName = path.basename(file); if (!indexContent.includes(fileName)) { console.warn(`Warning: ${fileName} is not linked in index.md`); } });}// Run the link checkcheckLinksInIndex();
